entry.title: Shot Through the Heart
entry.summary:
Author: SaviouroftheStars

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,158Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 72

Summary: Jason Todd died once. It didn’t stick. Now a revenant with a stuttering heartbeat and a soul that won’t stay buried, he hunts the things that crawl out of the dark. But nothing he’s fought—not demons, not ghosts, not monsters wearing human skin—comes close to the pair now stalking the hunter circuit. They’re carving through veteran hunters like wheat. One is a towering brute in a mask.The other is a beautiful, shackled young man whose presence feels like gravity—quiet, strange, and impossible to ignore. Every instinct Jason has screams danger. Something about him feels ancient, bound, wrong. And yet Jason can’t look away. He’s going to have to kill them both. He just wishes the pretty one wasn’t making the job so damn complicated.

entry.title: retroreflector
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,633Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 41

Summary: [Tim catches the movement the instant it happens and then watches, pulse hitching, as Jason leans in—slow, lazy, the kind of movement that really should only happen in private, behind closed doors, not just out of sight enough from the Wayne Enterprises Scholarship fundraiser happening three floors below—and breathes in the smoke spilling from Dick’s lips. The burning ember flares, casting a stark, molten outline over the few inches of space between their mouths. For one suspended moment, it illuminates nothing but hunger. Tim swallows. Hard. Pretends that he’s never seen that expression in the mirror.] or, Tim Drake is perfectly content to be a voyeur, watching Dick and Jason unravel each other on a shadowed balcony at a Wayne Enterprises fundraiser—from a careful five feet and four inches away. entry.title: A View from the Top Bunk
entry.summary:
Author: Kinery

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,024Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Summary: The click of wheels and a drawn-out whistle split the forest silence, shaking the air. The train carried to another country not just hundreds of passengers, but also their stories, thoughts, and emotions. On such journeys, time seems to freeze in place. Dick clung to that feeling. Two rode in one compartment. Two killers, two mercenaries, teacher and apprentice. But it was here they could lower their masks, if only until morning. To think, to dream, and to do what could never be fulfilled in life—if only in their own minds.

entry.title: concussion confessions
entry.summary:
Author: littlewing (satorusyuji)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,771Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 173

Summary: Arkham Knight's words are clipped. “Are you saying I have cat ears?” It takes Dick’s brain a generous moment to catch up. He's all gunked up, slow to process. Definitely not firing on every cylinder. Probably not even half of them. “Yeah.” Dick narrows his eyes, gaze locked on said ears. “Don’t you?” “They’re b–” Arkham Knight snaps, then abruptly cuts himself off. Takes an audible breath even through the helmet. “No. I don't.” “You totally do,” Dick argues, tone dreamy. His eyes slide back down. He grins. “It's cute. You're a kitty cat. Big, buff, scary kitty cat.” — Dick gets a concussion mid-fight and is miraculously saved by none other than the Arkham Knight. While waiting for the cavalry, they chat. It leads to something neither of them quite expected.
